intro: Mahernia incana, commonly known as the hairy mahernia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive hairy leaves and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Mahernia incana is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts well to dry and windy conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanists and gardeners alike.
